intro: Sphaeranthus kotschyi, commonly known as the mountain sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a small annual herb with a compact, globular growth habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Sphaeranthus kotschyi is characterized by its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitats.
